concept.title: Default open ports
concept.shortdesc: The following ports are open by default on the IBM StoredIQ.

copyright.copyrholder: © Copyright International Business Machines Corporation 2001, 2019. US Government Users Restricted Rights – Use, duplication or disclosure restricted by GSA ADP Schedule Contract with IBM Corp.

prodinfo.prodname: IBM StoredIQ Deployment and Configuration Guide

conbody.p: By default, port 22 is open on all IBM StoredIQ hosts. The port is used for Secure Shell (SSH) communication and allows remote administration access to the VM. In general, traffic is encrypted using password authentication. To add a layer of security, you can establish key-based authentication for passwordless SSH logins to any of the IBM StoredIQ nodes in your environment as described in Configuring SSH key-based authentication” on page 45.“

section.title: Default open ports on the AppStack

table.title: Default open ports on the IBM StoredIQ data server

row.entry: PROD-transport (IBM StoredIQ transport services; communication between the gateway and the data server)

section.title: Enable or disable ports or services on the IBM StoredIQ data server

section.title: Default open ports on the nodes in the Elasticsearch cluster

strow.stentry: SimpleHTTPServer (used for copying the siq-elasticsearch.yml configuration file from the Elasticsearch node to the dataserver)

docker-proxy (listening for RESTrequests)
You can restrict access to this port by either enabling SearchGuard or by setting up a firewall. For more information, see “Securing Elasticsearch cluster communication with SearchGuard” on page 51 or “Restricting access to port 9200 on Elasticsearch nodes” on page 52.

table.title: Default open ports on the IBM StoredIQ gateway

row.entry: PROD-transport (IBM StoredIQ transport services; communication between the gateway and the data server)

section.title: Supported chain and rules on the IBM StoredIQ gateway
section.p: In iptables, the following firewall and chain rules are defined:

section.title: Open ports for desktop client access to the data server
section.p: To open ports for desktop client access to the data server on OVA deployed systems, follow these steps:

ol.li: Log in to the data server as root and run this command: python /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc -e desktop

Run this command: iptables -L INPUT
In the output of the command, check the list position of the rule that is named PROD-reject, for example, the 6th position on the list.
Run this command: iptables -A INPUT -j PROD-reject

Run this command: iptables -D INPUT list_position
list_position is the position number of the PROD-reject rule that you determined in step 2.
Run the following command: python /usr/local/storediq/bin/util/port_handler.pyc -e desktop

section.note: These steps are required only on an IBM StoredIQ OVA deployed system. The correct ports are open on an upgraded system.

link.desc: When you plan a deployment of IBM StoredIQ, evaluate several infrastructure considerations.
